meanings.definition: To catch or capture in a trap.
meanings.sent1: I trape the mouse in the cage.
meanings.sent2: She always trapes butterflies in her garden.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat trapes the toy mouse every time.
meanings.sent4: His words trape me into believing his story.
meanings.sent5: The spider skillfully trapes its prey in the web.

meanings.definition: A device used for trapping animals.
meanings.sent1: The trape caught the rabbit in the forest.
meanings.sent2: He set up a trape to catch the pesky raccoons.
meanings.sent3: The rusty trape in the attic was still functional.
meanings.sent4: The trape lay hidden, waiting for its unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent5: The trape was carefully placed to ensnare the cunning fox.

meanings.definition: A trick or stratagem used to deceive or ensnare.
meanings.sent1: Her apology was just a trape to avoid punishment.
meanings.sent2: The con artist's trape fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: His plan was a clever trape to outsmart his opponents.
meanings.sent4: The trape of false promises led him into a trap.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the trape of easy money schemes.
